Articles.Content:
Looks like I will finally be able to build a new PC to replace my 6 year old dying machine. I have been doing some research into all the new technologies and will likely be building something in the $1500-$1800 price range, so I should be able to setup a fairly decent machine (one for the next 6 years I hope). This will be a PC used almost entirely for gaming.

Anyway, my question for the moment is about system memory. How many GB should I plan on?

I am initially planning on 16 GB in a 2x8 setup, and I can probably choose a MB that has 4 slots total for expansion later if necessary. Is there any reason to need more than 16 GB right now? I am planning to install Windows 10 Home 64 bit (my current PC is still Vista, LOL), what kind of memory use can I expect from the OS alone?
Windows 10 x64 uses less than one for me, and 16 GB should be enough for almost everything. Also, this should be moved to the computer build thread.
16 GB will be fine for gaming now. More is really professional workstation server territory.

Also, this should be moved to the computer build thread.

Oops! My bad, sorry I should have paid more attention to the stickied threads. Thanks for the feedback on the memory though.
